channel.title: Firefox search engine help
channel.description: I restarted my computer because i was installing something that needed a restart then I opened Firefox and went to the Google search engine in the top right but it's gone. If I go to manage search engines it's not there and restore defaults is unselectable. I'm stumped any ideas?

item.title: Firefox search engine help
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“insane death, post:3, topic:98145”]Thanks for that the google.xml file must have got corrupted because it was 0KB and had no text.
I didn’t notice my bookmarks were gone either so you helped me fix them.

Thanks again ;)[/quote]

No problem. When I did it, I just ignored it and carried on, tabbing open the home button when I need to use search, now it’s become a habit but after collecting most bookmarks back, I needed to format and had a nice little search to find the previous information out.

Read full topic

Thanks again

item.title: Firefox search engine help
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Ok, this has happened to me before and I lost my bookmarks.

To fix search engines, extract this file(6KB) C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\searchplugins , so it looks like this.

To fix your bookmarks, open:
C:\Documents and Settings\Niall\Application Data\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\Profile1\bookmarkbackups

Change “Niall” to your login name, change Profile1 to the only visible folder in \Firefox\Profiles, copy the most recent file from Boommarkbackups to:
C:\Documents and Settings\Niall\Application Data\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\Profile1
and rename it to “bookmarks.html”.

Read full topic
